subject: Franchises
lead_paragraph: A group of Seattle women, led by the former deputy mayor Anne Levinson, will buy the Seattle Storm of the W.N.B.A. from the SuperSonics’ owner, Clay Bennett, for $10 million. The purchase option for the franchise was completed in the last few days, ensuring the Storm would remain in Seattle, while Bennett continues his push to move the SuperSonics to his hometown of Oklahoma City. The group, calling itself Force 10 Hoops, has until the end of February to close the sale and would need approval from the W.N.B.A. Board of Governors.
